column4: i am installing  and have got to the  " detecting hardware please wait"  loading module 'usb-storage' and it seems to have hung , it has been on that for over 10 mins  , is that normal ?
Not really... You might consider removing that specific hardware untill the install is finished
Depends of course on the hardware...
Nothing is being attached to the USB then?
Are you sure, that both the installer was burned well, or the USB works flawless?
You might adresss your replies directly, using the name before the reply. I might miss a few lines otherwise. Can you explain the exact step when the installer stops working?
: small window , Title : installing system , detecting harware, please wait , progress bar at 90% , Loading modual 'usb-storage' for USB storage' ...
you might switch to the command line interface, and give the command dmesg, or start gnome-terminal using alt+f2, and do the same...
the installer impacted to an error, and it is not able on solving it, but we can still find out (hopefully) what is causing the rror
: how do i break out of where it is , the installer still has control of the system ?
: how do i break out of where it is , the installer still has control of the system ?
Told you already... Press either Ctrl+Alt+F1 or use Alt+F2
: hung going to the command line now  , loading please wait ..... ,
did you switch to your CLI console mode? You can switch between the virtual terminals using Ctrl+Alt+Fx
: ok i'm in the comand line running the command dmsg, probing / checking / usb 1-8 disconect , bus busy wait 0  , unknown sensor , probe of 1-8 fail with error -22
Sounds not good... Did you try to google this error already?
Ok, as I have no generic advice, try to turn off acpi at start, before you load up the installer.. Set "acpi=off" at GRUB
